chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
k: nat
j: nat
m: nat
n: nat
v: Vector.t nat k

Goal:
divides (qs n) (exp j v) <-> divides (qs (m + n)) (exp (m + j) v)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
exp = fix exp (n i : nat) (v : vec nat n) {struct v} : nat := match v with | vec_nil => 1 | Vector.cons _ x n0 v0 => qs i ^ x * exp n0 (S i) v0 end : forall n : nat, nat -> vec nat n -> nat Arguments exp {n}%nat_scope _%nat_scope
qs = {| str := fun n : nat => nthprime (1 + 2 * n); str_inj := fun (n m : nat) (H : nthprime (1 + 2 * n) = nthprime (1 + 2 * m)) => let H0 : 1 + 2 * n = 1 + 2 * m := nthprime_inj (1 + 2 * n) (1 + 2 * m) H in (fun lemma : n = m <-> BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (n = m) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat BinNums.Z eq BinInt.Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) n (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) eq_refl m (BinInt.Z.of_nat m) eq_refl) (let H1 : BinInt.Z.add (BinNum
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
qs_exp_div : forall (i j n : nat) (v : vec nat n), i < j -> ~ divides (qs i) (exp j v)
ps_exp : forall (n m : nat) (v : vec nat m) (i : nat), ~ divides (ps n) (exp i v)
ps_qs_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (ps n) (qs m)
qs_ps_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (qs n) (ps m)
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p
vec_plus_cons : forall (n x : nat) (v : vec nat n) (y : nat) (w : vec nat n), vec_plus (x ## v) (y ## w) = x + y ## vec_plus v w
Nat.mul_add_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, n * (m + p) = n * m + n * p
Nat.add_sub_assoc : forall n m p : nat, p <= m -> n + (m - p) = n + m - p
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
bounded_search : forall (m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}
vec_prod_div : forall (m : nat) (v : vec nat m) (u0 : nat) (p : pos m) (i : nat), v#>p = S u0 -> qs (p + i) * exp i (v[u0/p]) = exp i v
divides_plus : forall p q1 q2 : nat, divides p q1 -> divides p q2 -> divides p (q1 + q2)
divides_plus_inv : forall p q1 q2 : nat, divides p q1 -> divides p (q1 + q2) -> divides p q2
divides_bool_spec : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = true < -> divides (S n) p
vec_plus_assoc : forall (n : nat) (u v w : vec nat n), vec_plus u (vec_plus v w) = vec_plus (vec_plus u v) w
divides_bool_spec' : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = false < -> ~ divides (S n) p
divides_dec : forall q p : nat, {k : nat | q = k * p} + {~ divides p q}
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat j : nat k : nat v : vec nat k |- nat]
exp_cons : forall (n i x : nat) (v : vec nat n), exp i (x ## v) = qs i ^ x * exp (S i) v
modS_divide : forall n p : nat, p mod S n = 0 < -> divides (S n) p
vec_app_cons : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (x : X) (v : vec X n) (w : vec X m), vec_app (x ## v) w = x ## vec_app v w
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ divides q p} + {prime p}
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
divides_rem_eq : forall q p : nat, divides p q < -> rem q p = 0
vec_pos_plus : forall (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) (p : pos n), vec_plus v w#>p = (v#>p) + (w#>p)
exp_app : forall (n m i : nat) (v : vec nat n) (w : vec nat m), exp i (vec_app v w) = exp i v * exp (n + i) w
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
vec_plus = fun (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) => vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => (v#>p) + (w#>p)) : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> vec nat n -> vec nat n Arguments vec_plus {n}%nat_scope
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
divides_minus : forall p q1 q2 : nat, divides p q1 -> divides p q2 -> divides p (q1 - q2)
Nat.add_comm : forall n m : nat, n + m = m + n
primestream_divides : forall (ps : primestream) (n m : nat), divides (ps n) (ps m) -> n = m
divides_mult_inv : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
divides_mult_compat : forall a b c d : nat, divides a b -> divides c d -> divides (a * c) (b * d)
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)

``` 
intros. split.
- intros [x H]. exists x. rewrite Nat.add_assoc. rewrite (Nat.add_comm m). rewrite <- H. apply Nat.add_comm.
- intros [x H]. exists x. rewrite Nat.add_assoc in H. rewrite (Nat.add_comm m) in H. rewrite <- H. apply Nat.add_comm.
```
